sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { useProgress } from '../../contexts/ProgressContext'; import { useQuiz } from '../../contexts/QuizContext'; const NumberSystems = () => { const { markTopicComplete } = useProgress(); const { startQuiz } = useQuiz(); const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('introduction'); const content = { introduction: { title: "Introduction to Number Systems", content: (

A number system is a way to represent numbers using a set of symbols and rules. In computer science, we primarily work with four number systems:

Binary (Base 2)

Uses only two digits: 0 and 1. This is the fundamental language of computers.

Decimal (Base 10)

Uses ten digits: 0-9. This is the number system we use in daily life.

Octal (Base 8)

Uses eight digits: 0-7. Often used as a shorthand for binary.

Hexadecimal (Base 16)

Uses sixteen symbols: 0-9 and A-F. Commonly used in programming and memory addressing.

) }, conversions: { title: "Number System Conversions", content: (

Conversion Methods

Binary to Decimal

Multiply each binary digit by its positional value (powers of 2) and sum them up.

1011₂ = 1×2³ + 0×2² + 1×2¹ + 1×2⁰ = 8 + 0 + 2 + 1 = 11₁₀
Binary to Octal

Group binary digits in sets of 3 from right to left, then convert each group to octal.

Binary to Hexadecimal

Group binary digits in sets of 4 from right to left, then convert each group to hex.

) }, examples: { title: "Practice Examples", content: (

Worked Examples

Example 1: Convert 110101₂ to Decimal

110101₂ = 1×2⁵ + 1×2⁴ + 0×2³ + 1×2² + 0×2¹ + 1×2⁰
= 32 + 16 + 0 + 4 + 0 + 1 = 53₁₀

Example 2: Convert 243₈ to Binary

2₈ = 010₂, 4₈ = 100₂, 3₈ = 011₂
243₈ = 010100011₂ = 10100011₂
) } }; const quizData = { title: "Number Systems Quiz", questions: [ { id: 1, question: "What is the base of the binary number system?", options: ["2", "8", "10", "16"], correctAnswer: 0, explanation: "Binary system uses base 2, with only two digits: 0 and 1." }, { id: 2, question: "Convert 1011₂ to decimal:", options: ["10", "11", "12", "13"], correctAnswer: 1, explanation: "1×2³ + 0×2² + 1×2¹ + 1×2⁰ = 8 + 0 + 2 + 1 = 11" }, { id: 3, question: "What does hexadecimal use to represent values 10-15?", options: ["Numbers 10-15", "Letters A-F", "Special symbols", "Binary codes"], correctAnswer: 1, explanation: "Hexadecimal uses letters A-F to represent decimal values 10-15." } ], onComplete: (score) => { markTopicComplete('number-systems', score); alert(`Quiz completed! Your score: ${score}%`); } }; return (

Number Systems & Conversions

Learn the fundamental number systems used in computer science and how to convert between them

{/* Interactive Tools */}

Number Converter

1011
B

Quick Reference

Binary: 0, 1
Octal: 0-7
Decimal: 0-9
Hexadecimal: 0-9, A-F
{/* Quiz Button */}
); }; export default NumberSystems;
